andersenPage.title: Andersen Fairy Tales
andersenPage.subtitle: A literary–musical performance inspired by the fairy tales of Hans Christian Andersen

left.quote1: “My fairy tales are meant for adults, not only for children. Adults will understand them perfectly.”
left.lead: Welcome Christmas with the beloved heroes of Hans Christian Andersen’s fairy tales.

p1.before: And in 2025 we also commemorate 220 years since the birth of the world-famous Danish writer. The literary-musical performance based on
p1.accent: Hans Christian Andersen’s fairy tales is a kaleidoscope of the author’s finest works,
p1.after: accompanied by carefully curated pieces of world classical music. The performance is complemented by the brilliant painter and Antarctic traveler German Grott, who paints magical illustrations live on stage, projected onto a large screen.

p2.before: The literary passages will be performed by the renowned, award-winning actor

p3.before: Performed by the orchestra of the
p3.after: under the baton of the internationally acclaimed conductor
p3.program: in the program features musical works by Czech and international composers:
p3.autors: Dvořák, Janáček, Nielsen, Grieg, Tchaikovsky, Anderson.
p3.hudba: HuMusic combined with the spoken word of the literary work forms a cohesive performance.

p5.second: Andersen’s extraordinary imagination shines through in his tales and stories-touching and instructive, sad and merry-where it is equally important to be faithful and brave, honest and kind, to see beauty, and not to fear the passing of loved ones.

left.quote2: Andersen’s fairy tales form a shared cultural code for half of humanity. Many generations have grown up with them and interest in them does not fade-quite the opposite. The program consists of excerpts from popular tales as well as lesser-known stories by this exceptional Danish author. The concert-performance will captivate not only children but also adult audiences.
left.quote5: The Program consists of samples of popular fairy tales, as well as little-known stories of this exceptional Danish author. The concert performance will interest not only children, but also an adult audience.

left.quote1: “One sees clearly only with the heart. What is essential is invisible to the eye.”
left.lead: The Little Prince in a new artistic interpretation

p1.before: A unique literary–musical performance inspired by the timeless story
p1.accent: The Little Prince by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
p1.after: takes you back to a world where we rediscover joy, friendship and the beauty hidden in little things.

p2.before: Unforgettable passages come to life on stage, performed by the charismatic
p2.after: , whose voice and interpretation open the door to childlike imagination and profound life wisdom.

p3.before: The musical atmosphere is created by masterpieces of great composers –
p3.accent: Bach, Dvořák, Smetana, Saint-Saëns, Ravel, Debussy, Bizet

p4.after: are reborn — the brilliant painter and traveler German Grott brings them to canvas live during the performance.

left.quote2: This evening is an invitation for those who long to “see with the heart” again.
left.quote3: “You become responsible, forever, for what you have tamed.”

hero.title: Cookies
hero.subtitle: This page explains how EUTERPE STUDIO uses cookies and similar technologies for website operation, traffic measurement and personalised advertising (Google Ads, Sklik, Meta, etc.).

whatAre.title: 1. What are cookies
whatAre.text: Cookies are small text files stored on your device (computer, phone, tablet). They allow the website to recognise your device, remember certain preferences and understand how the website is used. Some cookies are essential for the site to function properly, others are used for analytics and marketing.

types.title: 2. What types of cookies we use
types.necessaryIntro: These cookies are required for the basic functions of the website and cannot be switched off. They ensure for example:
types.necessaryList1: display and navigation of the website,
types.necessaryList2: protection of forms and security against misuse,
types.necessaryNote: Necessary cookies do not store information that would on its own identify a specific person.
types.analyticsIntro: Analytics cookies help us understand how the website is used – they anonymously measure traffic, track the number of page views and general user behaviour. This allows us to improve the site and make it clearer.
types.analyticsGA: Google Analytics (GA4) stores anonymised statistical data – for example, which page visitors came from, which content is most frequently viewed or how long they stay on the site. IP addresses are processed in an anonymised form.
types.analyticsSklik: Seznam – Sklik conversion tracking is used to evaluate the performance of campaigns from the Sklik advertising network.
types.marketingIntro: We use marketing cookies to display more relevant ads (remarketing / retargeting) and to evaluate the effectiveness of advertising campaigns.
types.marketingText2: We do not create our own detailed profile of individual users based on these cookies; they are used within anonymised advertising audiences provided by Google, Seznam and Meta.

consentMode.title: 3. Google Consent Mode (v2)
consentMode.text: Our website uses Google Consent Mode v2. This means that if a visitor does not consent to analytics or marketing cookies, Google tools (such as Google Analytics, Google Ads) adjust their behaviour so that they do not use personalised cookies and work only with aggregated, anonymised signals.

sharing.title: 4. Who we share cookie data with
sharing.intro: For the above purposes, cookie data may be processed by the following partners:
sharing.list1: Google Ireland Ltd. (Google Analytics, Google Ads)
sharing.list4: other analytics and advertising providers we may use in the future
sharing.note: We never sell personal data to third parties.

manage.title: 5. How you can manage cookies
manage.text1: You can change or withdraw your consent to the use of individual categories of cookies at any time. On our website there is a control element (e.g. “Cookie settings”) in the footer where you can:
manage.text2: You can also manage cookies directly in your browser, where you can delete stored cookies or disable them entirely. In that case, however, some parts of the website may not function properly.

contact.title: 6. Contact
contact.text: If you have any questions regarding the use of cookies or personal data protection, you can contact us at:

cookies.footerNote: This cookie information may be updated from time to time to reflect changes in the technologies we use or in legal requirements.

hero.title: Privacy Policy
hero.subtitle: This page explains how EUTERPE STUDIO processes personal data of website visitors and clients in accordance with the GDPR.

data.title: 2. What personal data we process
data.formsList4: content of your message / project description,
data.formsList5: any additional information you voluntarily provide.
data.techList3: information about website visits (Google Analytics, Sklik etc.),
data.techList4: cookies – see the separate “Cookies” page for details.

purposes.title: 3. Purposes of personal data processing
purposes.intro: We process your personal data only for the following purposes:
purposes.list1: handling your enquiry or request sent via form or e-mail,
purposes.list2: preparing an offer and further communication regarding cooperation,
purposes.list3: maintaining internal records of clients and projects,
purposes.list4: statistical evaluation of website traffic and optimisation of the site,
purposes.list5: marketing campaigns (Google Ads, Sklik, Meta) based on your cookie consent.

legalBasis.title: 4. Legal basis for processing
legalBasis.intro: We process personal data on the basis of:
legalBasis.list1: Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR – performance of a contract and steps taken prior to entering into a contract (enquiries, orders, contractual communication),
legalBasis.list2: Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR – legitimate interest (traffic analysis, site security, basic marketing),
legalBasis.list3: Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR – consent (in particular for marketing cookies and personalised advertising).

recipients.title: 5. Who has access to the data
recipients.intro: Your personal data may be accessed by:
recipients.list1: the controller (EUTERPE STUDIO) and its internal collaborators,
recipients.list2: providers of IT and hosting services,
recipients.list3: providers of analytics and marketing tools:
recipients.sub1: Google Ireland Ltd. (Google Analytics, Google Ads),
recipients.note: All partners are contractually bound to protect personal data and comply with GDPR.

retention.title: 6. Data retention period
retention.intro: We store personal data only for as long as necessary:
retention.list1: contact forms and e-mail communication: typically 12 months from the last contact,
retention.list2: data required for contract performance and accounting: for the periods required by law (usually 5–10 years),
retention.list3: cookies and analytics data: according to the settings of each tool (see “Cookies”).

rights.title: 7. Your rights under GDPR
rights.intro: In connection with personal data processing you have the following rights:
rights.list1: right of access to your personal data,
rights.list2: right to rectification of inaccurate or outdated data,
rights.list3: right to erasure (“right to be forgotten”) where no legal grounds exist for further processing,
rights.list6: right to object to processing based on legitimate interest,
rights.list7: right to withdraw your consent at any time (for processing based on consent).
rights.contactText: You can exercise your rights by contacting us via e-mail:
rights.supervisorText: If you believe that we are processing your data in breach of data protection laws, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority:
rights.supervisorName: Office for Personal Data Protection (Úřad pro ochranu osobních údajů, www.uoou.cz).

security.title: 8. Data security
security.text: We protect personal data using organisational and technical measures. We use encrypted connections (HTTPS), secure e-mail servers and limited access only for authorised persons.

cookiesSection.title: 9. Cookies and online identifiers
cookiesSection.text: Information about the use of cookies, tracking codes and similar technologies can be found on the separate “Cookies” page.
